questions.question: Choose the correct sentence about missing a bus in third conditional form.
options: If she missed the bus, she would have been late.
If she had missed the bus, she would have been late.
If she has missed the bus, she would be late.
If she misses the bus, she will be late.
questions.answer: If she had missed the bus, she would have been late.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'If Mark had charged his phone, he _____ us.'
Choose the correct third conditional sentence related to a meeting.
options: If I meet her, I would have asked about the project.
If I met her, I would ask about the project.
If I had met her, I would have asked about the project.
If I had meet her, I would ask about the project.
questions.answer: If I had met her, I would have asked about the project.
